subject: History
title: D-Day: The Normandy Invasion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: D-Day: The Normandy Invasion.

hook.text: On June 6, 1944, 156,000 Allied soldiers stormed Normandy's beaches. It was the largest seaborne invasion in history.

buildup.text: Years of planning, deception, and intelligence went into Overlord. Fake armies misled Germany about the landing site.

discovery.text: Paratroopers dropped behind enemy lines at night. At dawn, soldiers hit five beaches under devastating German fire.

twist.text: At Omaha Beach, the first wave was nearly wiped out. The invasion almost failed before it began.

climax.text: By nightfall, the Allies held all five beaches. Within a month, one million troops were in France. Liberation had begun.

punchline.text: The longest day opened the door to victory.

quiz.question: How did the Allies deceive Germany about the D-Day landing location?
options: They launched a diversionary attack on Norway first
They used fake armies and misinformation to mislead Germany
They bribed German officers to reveal defensive positions
